an3.140:1.1.pli: “Tayo ca, bhikkhave, assakhaḷuṅke desessāmi tayo ca purisakhaḷuṅke.
an3.140:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you about three wild colts and three wild people.

an3.140:1.2.pli: Taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
an3.140:1.2.eng: Listen and apply your mind well, I will speak.”

an3.140:1.3.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ.

an3.140:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco assakhaḷuṅko javasampanno hoti; na vaṇṇasampanno, na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
an3.140:2.2.eng: One wild colt is fast, but not beautiful or well proportioned.

an3.140:2.3.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco assakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca; na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
an3.140:2.3.eng: Another wild colt is fast and beautiful, but not well proportioned.

an3.140:2.4.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco assakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca.
an3.140:2.4.eng: While another wild colt is fast, beautiful, and well proportioned.

an3.140:2.5.eng: These are the three wild colts.

an3.140:3.1.eng: And what are the three wild people?

an3.140:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno hoti; na vaṇṇasampanno, na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
an3.140:3.2.eng: One wild person is fast, but not beautiful or well proportioned.

an3.140:3.3.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca; na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
an3.140:3.3.eng: Another wild person is fast and beautiful, but not well proportioned.

an3.140:3.4.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca.
an3.140:3.4.eng: While another wild person is fast, beautiful, and well proportioned.

an3.140:4.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno hoti; na vaṇṇasampanno na ārohapariṇāhasampanno?
an3.140:4.1.eng: And how is a wild person fast, but not beautiful or well proportioned?

an3.140:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti …pe… ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
an3.140:4.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant truly understands: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.

an3.140:4.3.eng: This is how they’re fast, I say.

an3.140:4.4.pli: Abhidhamme kho pana abhivinaye pañhaṃ puṭṭho saṃsādeti, no vissajjeti.
an3.140:4.4.eng: But when asked a question about the teaching or training, they falter without answering.

an3.140:4.5.eng: This is how they’re not beautiful, I say.

an3.140:4.6.eng: And they don’t receive robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.

an3.140:4.7.eng: This is how they’re not well proportioned, I say.

an3.140:4.8.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno hoti; na vaṇṇasampanno, na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
an3.140:4.8.eng: This is how a wild person is fast, but not beautiful or well proportioned.

an3.140:5.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca; na ārohapariṇāhasampanno?
an3.140:5.1.eng: And how is a wild person fast and beautiful, but not well proportioned?

an3.140:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti …pe… ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
an3.140:5.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant truly understands: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.

an3.140:5.3.eng: This is how they’re fast, I say.

an3.140:5.4.pli: Abhidhamme kho pana abhivinaye pañhaṃ puṭṭho vissajjeti, no saṃsādeti.
an3.140:5.4.eng: When asked a question about the teaching or training, they answer without faltering.

an3.140:5.5.eng: This is how they’re beautiful, I say.

an3.140:5.6.eng: But they don’t receive robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.

an3.140:5.7.eng: This is how they’re not well proportioned, I say.

an3.140:5.8.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca; na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
an3.140:5.8.eng: This is how a wild person is fast and beautiful, but not well proportioned.

an3.140:6.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca?
an3.140:6.1.eng: And how is a wild person fast, beautiful, and well proportioned?

an3.140:6.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti …pe… ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
an3.140:6.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant truly understands: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.

an3.140:6.3.eng: This is how they’re fast, I say.

an3.140:6.4.pli: Abhidhamme kho pana abhivinaye pañhaṃ puṭṭho vissajjeti, no saṃsādeti.
an3.140:6.4.eng: When asked a question about the teaching or training, they answer without faltering.

an3.140:6.5.eng: This is how they’re beautiful, I say.

an3.140:6.6.eng: They receive robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.

an3.140:6.7.eng: This is how they’re well proportioned, I say.

an3.140:6.8.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, purisakhaḷuṅko javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca.
an3.140:6.8.eng: This is how a wild person is fast, beautiful, and well proportioned.

an3.140:6.9.eng: These are the three wild people.”

an3.141:1.1.pli: “Tayo ca, bhikkhave, assaparasse desessāmi tayo ca purisaparasse.
an3.141:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you the three excellent horses and the three excellent people.

an3.141:1.2.pli: Taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
an3.141:1.2.eng: Listen and apply your mind well, I will speak.”

an3.141:1.3.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ.

an3.141:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco assaparasso javasampanno hoti; na vaṇṇasampanno na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
an3.141:2.2.eng: One excellent horse is fast, but not beautiful or well proportioned.

an3.141:2.3.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco assaparasso javasampanno hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca; na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
an3.141:2.3.eng: Another excellent horse is fast and beautiful, but not well proportioned.

an3.141:2.4.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco assaparasso javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca.
an3.141:2.4.eng: While another excellent horse is fast, beautiful, and well proportioned.

an3.141:2.5.eng: These are the three excellent horses.

an3.141:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco purisaparasso javasampanno hoti; na vaṇṇasampanno na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
an3.141:3.2.eng: One excellent person is fast, but not beautiful or well proportioned.

an3.141:3.3.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco purisaparasso javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca; na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
an3.141:3.3.eng: Another excellent person is fast and beautiful, but not well proportioned.

an3.141:3.4.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco purisaparasso javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca.
an3.141:3.4.eng: While another excellent person is fast, beautiful, and well proportioned.

an3.141:4.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, purisaparasso javasampanno hoti; na vaṇṇasampanno, na ārohapariṇāhasampanno?
an3.141:4.1.eng: And how is an excellent person fast, but not beautiful or well proportioned?

an3.141:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā opapātiko hoti tattha parinibbāyī anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā.
an3.141:4.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant, with the ending of the five lower fetters, is reborn spontaneously. They’re extinguished there, and are not liable to return from that world.

an3.141:4.3.eng: This is how they’re fast, I say.

an3.141:4.4.pli: Abhidhamme kho pana abhivinaye pañhaṃ puṭṭho saṃsādeti, no vissajjeti.
an3.141:4.4.eng: But when asked a question about the teaching or training, they falter without answering.

an3.141:4.5.eng: This is how they’re not beautiful, I say.

an3.141:4.6.eng: And they don’t receive robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.

an3.141:4.7.pli: Idamassa na ārohapariṇāhasmiṃ vadāmi. Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, purisaparasso javasampanno hoti;
an3.141:4.7.eng: This is how they’re not well proportioned, I say. This is how an excellent person is fast,

an3.141:4.8.eng: but not beautiful or well proportioned.

an3.141:5.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, purisaparasso javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca, na ārohapariṇāhasampanno?
an3.141:5.1.eng: And how is an excellent person fast and beautiful, but not well proportioned?

an3.141:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā opapātiko hoti tattha parinibbāyī anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā.
an3.141:5.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant, with the ending of the five lower fetters, is reborn spontaneously. They’re extinguished there, and are not liable to return from that world.

an3.141:5.3.eng: This is how they’re fast, I say.

an3.141:5.4.pli: Abhidhamme kho pana abhivinaye pañhaṃ puṭṭho vissajjeti, no saṃsādeti.
an3.141:5.4.eng: When asked a question about the teaching or training, they answer without faltering.

an3.141:5.5.eng: This is how they’re beautiful, I say.

an3.141:5.6.eng: But they don’t receive robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.

an3.141:5.7.eng: This is how they’re not well proportioned, I say.

an3.141:5.8.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, purisaparasso javasampanno ca hoti; vaṇṇasampanno ca, na ārohapariṇāhasampanno.
an3.141:5.8.eng: This is how an excellent person is fast and beautiful, but not well proportioned.

an3.141:6.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, purisaparasso javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca?
an3.141:6.1.eng: And how is an excellent person fast, beautiful, and well proportioned?

an3.141:6.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā opapātiko hoti tattha parinibbāyī anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā.
an3.141:6.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant, with the ending of the five lower fetters, is reborn spontaneously. They’re extinguished there, and are not liable to return from that world.

an3.141:6.3.eng: This is how they’re fast, I say.

an3.141:6.4.pli: Abhidhamme kho pana abhivinaye pañhaṃ puṭṭho vissajjeti, no saṃsādeti.
an3.141:6.4.eng: When asked a question about the teaching or training, they answer without faltering.

an3.141:6.5.eng: This is how they’re beautiful, I say.

an3.141:6.6.eng: They receive robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.

an3.141:6.7.eng: This is how they’re well proportioned, I say.

an3.141:6.8.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, purisaparasso javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca.
an3.141:6.8.eng: This is how an excellent person is fast, beautiful, and well proportioned.

an3.141:6.9.eng: These are the three excellent people.”

an3.142:1.1.pli: “Tayo ca, bhikkhave, bhadre assājānīye desessāmi tayo ca bhadre purisājānīye.
an3.142:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you the three fine thoroughbred horses, and the three fine thoroughbred people.

an3.142:1.2.pli: Taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
an3.142:1.2.eng: Listen and apply your mind well, I will speak.”

an3.142:1.3.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ.

an3.142:2.1.eng: “What are the three fine thoroughbred horses?

an3.142:2.3.pli: javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca.
an3.142:2.3.eng: is fast, beautiful, and well proportioned.

an3.142:2.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo bhadrā assājānīyā.
an3.142:2.4.eng: These are the three fine thoroughbred horses.

an3.142:3.1.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, tayo bhadrā purisājānīyā?
an3.142:3.1.eng: And what are the three fine thoroughbred people?

an3.142:3.3.pli: javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca.
an3.142:3.3.eng: is fast, beautiful, and well proportioned.

an3.142:4.1.eng: And how is a fine thoroughbred person …

an3.142:4.2.pli: javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca?

an3.142:4.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
an3.142:4.3.eng: It’s when a mendicant realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.

an3.142:4.4.eng: This is how they’re fast, I say.

an3.142:4.5.pli: Abhidhamme kho pana abhivinaye pañhaṃ puṭṭho vissajjeti, no saṃsādeti.
an3.142:4.5.eng: When asked a question about the teaching or training, they answer without faltering.

an3.142:4.6.eng: This is how they’re beautiful, I say.

an3.142:4.7.eng: They receive robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.

an3.142:4.8.eng: This is how they’re well proportioned, I say.

an3.142:4.9.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhadro purisājānīyo javasampanno ca hoti vaṇṇasampanno ca ārohapariṇāhasampanno ca.
an3.142:4.9.eng: This is how a fine thoroughbred person is fast, beautiful, and well proportioned.

an3.142:4.10.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo bhadrā purisājānīyā”ti.
an3.142:4.10.eng: These are the three fine thoroughbred people.”

an3.143:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati moranivāpe paribbājakārāme.
an3.143:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, at the monastery of the wanderers in the peacocks’ feeding ground.

an3.143:1.2.eng: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,

an3.143:2.1.pli: “Tīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu accantaniṭṭho hoti accantayogakkhemī accantabrahmacārī accantapariyosāno seṭṭho devamanussānaṃ.
an3.143:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, a mendicant with three qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary from the yoke, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal. They are the best among gods and humans.

an3.143:2.3.pli: Asekkhena sīlakkhandhena, asekkhena samādhikkhandhena, asekkhena paññākkhandhena.
an3.143:2.3.eng: The entire spectrum of an adept’s ethics, immersion, and wisdom.

an3.143:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu accantaniṭṭho hoti accantayogakkhemī accantabrahmacārī accantapariyosāno seṭṭho devamanussānan”ti.
an3.143:2.4.eng: A mendicant with these three qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary from the yoke, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal. They are the best among gods and humans.”

an3.144:1.1.pli: “Tīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu accantaniṭṭho hoti accantayogakkhemī accantabrahmacārī accantapariyosāno seṭṭho devamanussānaṃ.
an3.144:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, a mendicant who has three qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary from the yoke, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal. They are the best among gods and humans.

an3.144:1.3.eng: A demonstration of psychic power, a demonstration of revealing, and a demonstration of instruction.

an3.144:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu accantaniṭṭho hoti accantayogakkhemī accantabrahmacārī accantapariyosāno seṭṭho devamanussānan”ti.
an3.144:1.4.eng: A mendicant with these three qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary from the yoke, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal. They are the best among gods and humans.”

an3.145:1.1.pli: “Tīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu accantaniṭṭho hoti accantayogakkhemī accantabrahmacārī accantapariyosāno seṭṭho devamanussānaṃ.
an3.145:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, a mendicant who has three qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary from the yoke, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal. They are the best among gods and humans.

an3.145:1.3.eng: Right view, right knowledge, and right freedom.

an3.145:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu accantaniṭṭho hoti accantayogakkhemī accantabrahmacārī accantapariyosāno seṭṭho devamanussānan”ti.
an3.145:1.4.eng: A mendicant with these three qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary from the yoke, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal. They are the best among gods and humans.”

an3.146:1.1.pli: “Tīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an3.146:1.1.eng: “Someone with three qualities is cast down to hell.

an3.146:1.3.pli: Akusalena kāyakammena, akusalena vacīkammena, akusalena manokammena—
an3.146:1.3.eng: Unskillful deeds by way of body, speech, and mind.

an3.146:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an3.146:1.4.eng: Someone with these three qualities is cast down to hell.

an3.146:2.1.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge.
an3.146:2.1.eng: Someone with three qualities is raised up to heaven.

an3.146:2.3.pli: Kusalena kāyakammena, kusalena vacīkammena, kusalena manokammena—
an3.146:2.3.eng: Skillful deeds by way of body, speech, and mind.

an3.146:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge”ti.
an3.146:2.4.eng: Someone with these three qualities is raised up to heaven.”

an3.147:1.1.pli: “Tīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an3.147:1.1.eng: “Someone with three qualities is cast down to hell.

an3.147:1.3.pli: Sāvajjena kāyakammena, sāvajjena vacīkammena, sāvajjena manokammena—
an3.147:1.3.eng: Blameworthy deeds by way of body, speech, and mind.

an3.147:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an3.147:1.4.eng: Someone with these three qualities is cast down to hell.

an3.147:2.1.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge.
an3.147:2.1.eng: Someone with three qualities is raised up to heaven.

an3.147:2.3.pli: Anavajjena kāyakammena, anavajjena vacīkammena, anavajjena manokammena—
an3.147:2.3.eng: Blameless deeds by way of body, speech, and mind.

an3.147:2.4.eng: Someone with these three qualities is raised up to heaven.”

an3.148:1.1.eng: “Someone with three qualities is cast down to hell. …

an3.148:1.2.pli: visamena kāyakammena, visamena vacīkammena, visamena manokammena—
an3.148:1.2.eng: Unethical deeds by way of body, speech, and mind. …

an3.148:2.1.eng: Someone with three qualities is raised up to heaven. …

an3.148:2.2.pli: samena kāyakammena, samena vacīkammena, samena manokammena—
an3.148:2.2.eng: Ethical deeds by way of body, speech, and mind. …”

an3.149:1.1.eng: “Someone with three qualities is cast down to hell. …

an3.149:1.2.pli: asucinā kāyakammena, asucinā vacīkammena, asucinā manokammena—
an3.149:1.2.eng: Impure deeds by way of body, speech, and mind. …

an3.149:2.1.eng: Someone with three qualities is raised up to heaven. …

an3.149:2.2.pli: sucinā kāyakammena, sucinā vacīkammena, sucinā manokammena—
an3.149:2.2.eng: Pure deeds by way of body, speech, and mind. …”

an3.149:2.3.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge”ti.

an3.15:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā bārāṇasiyaṃ viharati isipatane migadāye.
an3.15:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying near Varanasi, in the deer park at Isipatana.

an3.15:1.2.eng: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,

an3.15:2.1.eng: “Once upon a time there was a king named Pacetana.

an3.15:2.2.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, rājā sacetano rathakāraṃ āmantesi:
an3.15:2.2.eng: Then King Pacetana addressed his chariot-maker,

an3.15:2.3.pli: ‘ito me, samma rathakāra, channaṃ māsānaṃ accayena saṅgāmo bhavissati.
an3.15:2.3.eng: ‘In six months’ time, my good chariot-maker, there will be a battle.

an3.15:2.4.pli: Sakkhissasi me, samma rathakāra, navaṃ cakkayugaṃ kātun’ti?
an3.15:2.4.eng: Are you able to make me a new pair of wheels?’

an3.15:2.5.pli: ‘Sakkomi, devā’ti kho, bhikkhave, rathakāro rañño sacetanassa paccassosi.
an3.15:2.5.eng: ‘I can, Your Majesty,’ replied the chariot-maker.

an3.15:2.6.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, rathakāro chahi māsehi chārattūnehi ekaṃ cakkaṃ niṭṭhāpesi.
an3.15:2.6.eng: Then, when it was six days less than six months later, the chariot-maker had finished one wheel.

an3.15:2.7.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, rājā sacetano rathakāraṃ āmantesi:
an3.15:2.7.eng: Then King Pacetana addressed his chariot-maker,

an3.15:2.8.pli: ‘ito me, samma rathakāra, channaṃ divasānaṃ accayena saṅgāmo bhavissati, niṭṭhitaṃ navaṃ cakkayugan’ti?
an3.15:2.8.eng: ‘In six days’ time there will be a battle. Is my new pair of wheels finished?’

an3.15:2.9.pli: ‘Imehi kho, deva, chahi māsehi chārattūnehi ekaṃ cakkaṃ niṭṭhitan’ti.
an3.15:2.9.eng: ‘Now that it is six days less than six months, Your Majesty, I have finished one wheel.’

an3.15:2.10.pli: ‘Sakkhissasi pana me, samma rathakāra, imehi chahi divasehi dutiyaṃ cakkaṃ niṭṭhāpetun’ti?
an3.15:2.10.eng: ‘Are you able to finish the second wheel in these six days?’

an3.15:2.11.pli: ‘Sakkomi, devā’ti kho, bhikkhave, rathakāro chahi divasehi dutiyaṃ cakkaṃ niṭṭhāpetvā navaṃ cakkayugaṃ ādāya yena rājā sacetano tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā rājānaṃ sacetanaṃ etadavoca:
an3.15:2.11.eng: Saying, ‘I can, Your Majesty,’ the chariot-maker finished the second wheel in six days. Taking the pair of wheels he went up to King Pacetana, and said this to the king,

an3.15:2.12.eng: ‘Your Majesty, these are your two new wheels, finished.’

an3.15:2.13.pli: ‘Yañca te idaṃ, samma rathakāra, cakkaṃ chahi māsehi niṭṭhitaṃ chārattūnehi yañca te idaṃ cakkaṃ chahi divasehi niṭṭhitaṃ, imesaṃ kiṃ nānākaraṇaṃ?
an3.15:2.13.eng: ‘But, my good chariot-maker, what is the difference between the wheel that was finished in six days less than six months, and the wheel finished in just six days?

an3.15:2.14.eng: Because I can’t see any difference between them.’

an3.15:2.15.eng: ‘But, Your Majesty, there is a difference.

an3.15:3.1.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, rathakāro yaṃ taṃ cakkaṃ chahi divasehi niṭṭhitaṃ taṃ pavattesi.
an3.15:3.1.eng: Then the chariot-maker rolled forth the wheel that had been finished in six days.

an3.15:3.2.pli: Taṃ pavattitaṃ samānaṃ yāvatikā abhisaṅkhārassa gati tāvatikaṃ gantvā ciṅgulāyitvā bhūmiyaṃ papati.
an3.15:3.2.eng: It rolled as far as the original impetus took it, then wobbled and fell down.

an3.15:3.3.pli: Yaṃ pana taṃ cakkaṃ chahi māsehi niṭṭhitaṃ chārattūnehi taṃ pavattesi.
an3.15:3.3.eng: Then he rolled forth the wheel that had been finished in six days less than six months.

an3.15:3.4.pli: Taṃ pavattitaṃ samānaṃ yāvatikā abhisaṅkhārassa gati tāvatikaṃ gantvā akkhāhataṃ maññe aṭṭhāsi.
an3.15:3.4.eng: It rolled as far as the original impetus took it, then stood still as if fixed to an axle.

an3.15:4.1.pli: ‘Ko nu kho, samma rathakāra, hetu ko paccayo yamidaṃ cakkaṃ chahi divasehi niṭṭhitaṃ taṃ pavattitaṃ samānaṃ yāvatikā abhisaṅkhārassa gati tāvatikaṃ gantvā ciṅgulāyitvā bhūmiyaṃ papati?
an3.15:4.1.eng: ‘But what is the cause, my good chariot-maker, what is the reason why the wheel that was finished in six days wobbled and fell,

an3.15:4.2.pli: Ko pana, samma rathakāra, hetu ko paccayo yamidaṃ cakkaṃ chahi māsehi niṭṭhitaṃ chārattūnehi taṃ pavattitaṃ samānaṃ yāvatikā abhisaṅkhārassa gati tāvatikaṃ gantvā akkhāhataṃ maññe aṭṭhāsī’ti?
an3.15:4.2.eng: while the one that was finished in six days less than six months stood still as if fixed to an axle?’

an3.15:4.3.pli: ‘Yamidaṃ, deva, cakkaṃ chahi divasehi niṭṭhitaṃ tassa nemipi savaṅkā sadosā sakasāvā, arāpi savaṅkā sadosā sakasāvā, nābhipi savaṅkā sadosā sakasāvā.
an3.15:4.3.eng: ‘The wheel that was finished in six days, Your Majesty, is crooked, flawed, and defective in rim, spoke, and hub.

an3.15:4.4.pli: Taṃ nemiyāpi savaṅkattā sadosattā sakasāvattā, arānampi savaṅkattā sadosattā sakasāvattā, nābhiyāpi savaṅkattā sadosattā sakasāvattā pavattitaṃ samānaṃ yāvatikā abhisaṅkhārassa gati tāvatikaṃ gantvā ciṅgulāyitvā bhūmiyaṃ papati.
an3.15:4.4.eng: That’s why it wobbled and fell.

an3.15:4.5.pli: Yaṃ pana taṃ, deva, cakkaṃ chahi māsehi niṭṭhitaṃ chārattūnehi tassa nemipi avaṅkā adosā akasāvā, arāpi avaṅkā adosā akasāvā, nābhipi avaṅkā adosā akasāvā.
an3.15:4.5.eng: The wheel that was finished in six days less than six months, Your Majesty, is not crooked, flawed, and defective in rim, spoke, and hub.

an3.15:4.6.pli: Taṃ nemiyāpi avaṅkattā adosattā akasāvattā, arānampi avaṅkattā adosattā akasāvattā, nābhiyāpi avaṅkattā adosattā akasāvattā pavattitaṃ samānaṃ yāvatikā abhisaṅkhārassa gati tāvatikaṃ gantvā akkhāhataṃ maññe aṭṭhāsī’ti.
an3.15:4.6.eng: That’s why it stood still as if fixed to an axle.’

an3.15:5.1.pli: Siyā kho pana, bhikkhave, tumhākaṃ evamassa:

an3.15:5.2.pli: ‘añño nūna tena samayena so rathakāro ahosī’ti.
an3.15:5.2.eng: ‘Surely that chariot-maker must have been someone else at that time?’

an3.15:5.3.pli: Na kho panetaṃ, bhikkhave, evaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.
an3.15:5.3.eng: But you should not see it like that.

an3.15:5.4.pli: Ahaṃ tena samayena so rathakāro ahosiṃ.
an3.15:5.4.eng: I myself was the chariot-maker at that time.

an3.15:5.5.pli: Tadāhaṃ, bhikkhave, kusalo dāruvaṅkānaṃ dārudosānaṃ dārukasāvānaṃ.
an3.15:5.5.eng: Then I was skilled in the crooks, flaws, and defects of wood.

an3.15:5.6.pli: Etarahi kho panāhaṃ, bhikkhave, arahaṃ sammāsambuddho kusalo kāyavaṅkānaṃ kāyadosānaṃ kāyakasāvānaṃ, kusalo vacīvaṅkānaṃ vacīdosānaṃ vacīkasāvānaṃ, kusalo manovaṅkānaṃ manodosānaṃ manokasāvānaṃ.
an3.15:5.6.eng: Now that I am a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha, I am skilled in the crooks, flaws, and defects of actions by body, speech, and mind.

an3.15:5.7.pli: Yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhussa vā bhikkhuniyā vā kāyavaṅko appahīno kāyadoso kāyakasāvo, vacīvaṅko appahīno vacīdoso vacīkasāvo, manovaṅko appahīno manodoso manokasāvo, evaṃ papatitā te, bhikkhave, imasmā dhammavinayā, seyyathāpi taṃ cakkaṃ chahi divasehi niṭṭhitaṃ.
an3.15:5.7.eng: Whatever monk or nun has not given up the crooks, flaws, and defects of body, speech, and mind has fallen from the teaching and training, just like the wheel that was finished in six days.

an3.15:6.1.pli: Yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhussa vā bhikkhuniyā vā kāyavaṅko pahīno kāyadoso kāyakasāvo, vacīvaṅko pahīno vacīdoso vacīkasāvo, manovaṅko pahīno manodoso manokasāvo, evaṃ patiṭṭhitā te, bhikkhave, imasmiṃ dhammavinaye, seyyathāpi taṃ cakkaṃ chahi māsehi niṭṭhitaṃ chārattūnehi.
an3.15:6.1.eng: Whatever monk or nun has given up the crooks, flaws, and defects of body, speech, and mind is established in the teaching and training, just like the wheel that was finished in six days less than six months.

an3.15:7.1.eng: So you should train like this:

an3.15:7.2.pli: ‘kāyavaṅkaṃ pajahissāma kāyadosaṃ kāyakasāvaṃ, vacīvaṅkaṃ pajahissāma vacīdosaṃ vacīkasāvaṃ, manovaṅkaṃ pajahissāma manodosaṃ manokasāvan’ti.
an3.15:7.2.eng: ‘We will give up the crooks, flaws, and defects of body, speech, and mind.’

an3.150:1.1.pli: “Tīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bālo abyatto asappuriso khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati, sāvajjo ca hoti sānuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ, bahuñca apuññaṃ pasavati.
an3.150:1.1.eng: “When a foolish, incompetent untrue person has three qualities they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and reproved by sensible people, and they brim with much wickedness.

an3.150:1.3.pli: Akusalena kāyakammena, akusalena vacīkammena, akusalena manokammena—
an3.150:1.3.eng: Unskillful deeds by way of body, speech, and mind. …

an3.150:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato bālo abyatto asappuriso khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati, sāvajjo ca hoti sānuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ, bahuñca apuññaṃ pasavati.

an3.150:2.1.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato paṇḍito viyatto sappuriso akkhataṃ anupahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati, anavajjo ca hoti ananuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ, bahuñca puññaṃ pasavati.
an3.150:2.1.eng: When an astute, competent true person has three qualities they keep themselves intact and unscathed. They don’t deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they brim with much merit.

an3.150:2.3.pli: Kusalena kāyakammena, kusalena vacīkammena, kusalena manokammena …pe….
an3.150:2.3.eng: Skillful deeds by way of body, speech, and mind. …”

an3.151:1.1.eng: “When a foolish, incompetent untrue person has three qualities they keep themselves broken and damaged. …

an3.151:1.2.pli: sāvajjena kāyakammena, sāvajjena vacīkammena, sāvajjena manokammena …pe….
an3.151:1.2.eng: Blameworthy deeds by way of body, speech, and mind. …

an3.151:2.1.eng: When an astute, competent true person has three qualities they keep themselves intact and unscathed. …

an3.151:2.2.pli: anavajjena kāyakammena, anavajjena vacīkammena, anavajjena manokammena …pe….
an3.151:2.2.eng: Blameless deeds by way of body, speech, and mind. …”

an3.152:1.1.eng: “When a foolish, incompetent untrue person has three qualities they keep themselves broken and damaged. …

an3.152:1.2.pli: visamena kāyakammena, visamena vacīkammena, visamena manokammena …pe….
an3.152:1.2.eng: Unethical deeds by way of body, speech, and mind. …

an3.152:2.1.eng: When an astute, competent true person has three qualities they keep themselves intact and unscathed. …

an3.152:2.2.pli: samena kāyakammena, samena vacīkammena, samena manokammena …pe….
an3.152:2.2.eng: Ethical deeds by way of body, speech, and mind. …”

an3.153:1.1.eng: “When a foolish, incompetent untrue person has three qualities they keep themselves broken and damaged. …

an3.153:1.2.pli: asucinā kāyakammena, asucinā vacīkammena, asucinā manokammena …pe….
an3.153:1.2.eng: Impure deeds by way of body, speech, and mind. …

an3.153:2.1.eng: When an astute, competent true person has three qualities they keep themselves intact and unscathed. …

an3.153:2.2.pli: sucinā kāyakammena, sucinā vacīkammena, sucinā manokammena—
an3.153:2.2.eng: Pure deeds by way of body, speech, and mind. …”

an3.153:2.3.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato paṇḍito viyatto sappuriso akkhataṃ anupahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati, anavajjo ca hoti ananuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ, bahuñca puññaṃ pasavatī”ti.
